description: From Medieval Latin quantificare (introduced by Sir William Hamilton in logic).

verbs.description: quantify (third-person singular simple present quantifies, present participle quantifying, simple past and past participle quantified)

entries.meaning: To determine the value of (a variable or expression).
(logic) To relate a statement (called a predicate) to a given set using a quantifier—either for all (denoted ∀) or there exists (denoted ∃).
examples:
The statement 
  
    
      
        (
        ∀
        x
        ∈
        
          R
        
        )
        
        2
        x
        =
        x
        +
        x
      
    
    {\displaystyle (\forall x\in \mathbb {R} )\,2x=x+x}
  
 quantifies over the real numbers.
